alert.note: Alert for White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 10 at 1:54AM MST until December 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 12 inches possible. Higher amounts are possible near the Sunrise Ski Resort in the White Mountains. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Alpine, Pinetop-Lakeside, Show Low, and Whiteriver. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact both the morning and evening commutes. Snow forecast from 5 AM Monday to 11 PM Monday: Alpine 3 to 5 inches Pinetop-Lkside 4 to 8 inches Show Low 4 to 6 inches Whiteriver 4 to 6 inches.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant snow accumulations. These conditions may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts. Additional weather information is on the web at www.weather.gov/flagstaff
